metadata.title: CVE-2018-15607 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.8-11 Q16, a tiny input file 0x50 0x36 0x36 0x36 0x360x4c 0x36 0x38 0x36 0x36 0x36 0x36 0x36 0x36 0x1f 0x35 0x50 0x00 can resultin a hang of several minutes during which CPU and memory resources areconsumed until ultimately an attempted large memory allocation fails.Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial ofservice via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15607` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.14').
